title: Bouncer who choked wife to death with bra strap and electric cord has sentence EXTENDED after appealing jail term
text:
Bouncer who choked wife to death with bra strap and electric cord has sentence EXTENDED after appealing jail term Abul Kashem Miah, 37, murdered mum-of-two Rukshana Miah, 35, at their old home in Stockport, Greater Manchester Share Abul Kashem Miah was jailed for killing his wife Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! A bouncer who strangled his wife with a bra strap after stealing her £20,000 "wedding dowry" has had his murder sentence extended after failing in a bid to clear his name. 
Abul Kashem Miah, 39, killed primary school teacher Rukshana Miah, 35, at their former home after he "lost control" and snapped in anger in August 2014. 
The vicious bully, from Stockport, Greater Manchester, was convicted of murder in November 2015. 
The nightclub and bar bouncer said his actions amounted to manslaughter and has now tried to claim he had an unfair trial and he was mentally unwell at the time of police interview, reports Manchester Evening News . Mum-of-two Rukshana Miah was murdered by Abul Kashem Miah Read More Adam Johnson's ex-girlfriend Stacey Flounders arrives at court as disgraced footballer launches appeal bid over child sex conviction 
But on Friday the Court of Appeal rejected his bid to overturn the conviction, deeming it a "hopeless" case from the start. 
Lord Justice Simon said: “There was no proper basis for excluding his interview. He never raised an issue as to his mental state at the time. He was assessed by health professionals as fit to be interviewed.” 
Miah was initially given a life sentence but the dismissed appeal means he will have to serve 60 more days inside before seeking parole. 
His trial at Manchester Crown Court heard how Miah stole his wife's gold wedding dowry — including bangles, necklace and earrings — and made a bogus insurance claim on it before locking it in a safe. 
Mum-of-two who 'attacked child killer Rose West in prison' admits: I got sick of it so I cracked her 
The precious jewellery had been given to Rukshana Miah by his family on her marriage according to Bangladeshi custom. 
When the mother-of-two threatened to accuse him of rape unless he returned the jewellery on August 17, 2014, Miah suddenly snapped and strangled his partner. 
He wrapped the teacher in a duvet and fled the house, jurors were told. 
She died days later in hospital. Like us on Facebook
